Hello! How can I assist you with Chemist:
To calculate the enthalpy change \(\Delta H_r\), we use the formula provided:

\[
\Delta H_r = \Sigma \Delta H_f^\circ (\text{products}) - \Sigma \Delta H_f^\circ (\text{reactants})
\]

Substituting the given values:

\[
\Delta H_r = [2(-580) + 3(-1438) + 3(-286)] - [(-2061) + 4(-437) + 3(-814)]
\]

Calculate each side:

For products:
- \(2(-580) = -1160\)
- \(3(-1438) = -4314\)
- \(3(-286) = -858\)

Sum for products: \(-1160 - 4314 - 858 = -6332\)

For reactants:
- \(-2061\)
- \(4(-437) = -1748\)
- \(3(-814) = -2442\)

Sum for reactants: \(-2061 - 1748 - 2442 = -6251\)

Calculate \(\Delta H_r\):

\[
\Delta H_r = -6332 - (-6251) = -6332 + 6251 = -81 \, \text{kJ/mol}
\]

The enthalpy change for the reaction is \(-81 \, \text{kJ/mol}\).
